intro: Pluchea foliolosa, commonly known as Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed segments, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in various soil conditions. Additionally, it has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
